data.title: Results for: All Categories
data.meta_description: See below our stock of Rudyard Kipling First Editions, fine bindings, sets and other collectible material.
data.text:
Pharos The Egyptian [in] The Windsor Magazine. Volume 8.

[BOOTHBY, Guy (1867-1905); DOYLE, Arthur Conan; and Kipling, Rudyard, et al.]

London: Ward, Lock and Co., June to November 1898. [Literary Magazine] FIRST APPEARANCES. Octavo (24 x 17cm), pp.vi; 716. With many photogravure illustrations. Contemporary deep burgundy half calf with gilt titles to spine and dark green foliate cloth. All edges flecked red; yellow coated endpapers. Binding rubbed and worn, slightly..... More

[DOYLE, Arthur Conan, and KIPLING, Rudyard, et al.]

London: Ward, Lock and Co., 1898. [Literary Magazine]. FIRST APPEARANCES. Octavo (25 x 18cm), pp.vi; 3-716. With numerous in-text lithographic illustrations. In publisher's green cloth with red titles to spine and upper board. Brown floral endpapers. With a PSA Book Fund bookplate to front pastedown. Some gatherings a little loose;..... More

A School History of England.

FLETCHER, C.R.L. (1857-1934) and KIPLING, [Joseph] Rudyard (1865-1936), [FORD, Henry, illustrator].

Oxford: at the Clarendon Press, 1911. [British History] FINELY BOUND FIRST EDITION. Octavo (19 x 13cm), pp.[2] 250 [4]. With 10 colour plates by Ford, as well as various maps and drawings. Contemporary navy full calf by RELFE BROS for Langport Grammar School, with raised bands, gilt titles and decoration..... More

London: Ward, Lock and Co., December 1900 to November 1901. [Literary Magazine] FIRST APPEARANCES. In two volumes. Octavo (24 x 18cm), pp.vi; 754; pp.vi; 714. KIPLING, Rudyard and Edward GERMAN.

London, MacMillan and Co., Limited, 1903. First Edition. Quarto. Publisher's pictorial red cloth, depicting scenes from the Just So Stories. With music and lyrics to twelve songs. Head and tail of spine lightly rubbed. Text is clean. Near fine. More
